Key Match Events: Kevin Durant spearheaded the Suns with 25 points, seven rebounds and three steals, while Bradley Beal had 24 markers and three boards.
The Clippers held a 10-point lead at the halfway point of the fourth quarter before the Suns stormed back and forced overtime.
Norman Powell hit a driving layup to cut the lead to two, 112-114, with 1:16 remaining.
After a turnover by Beal, Powell attempted a 3-pointer to take the lead for the Clippers, but missed.
Durant, on the other end, tried to put in the dagger, but missed it.
James Harden was fouled, made the first but missed the second, giving the ball back to Phoenix, who was up 114-113.
Jusuf Nurkic secured the board and made both.
Los Angeles went back to Harden, who lost the ball after being stolen by Grayson Allen, securing the Sunsâ€™ victory.
Post-Match Reflections: The Phoenix Suns squeaked past the Los Angeles Clippers, 116-113, in overtime to begin their NBA season on a positive note Thursday (Manila time) at the Intuit Dome in California.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game went into overtime after a clutch Durant jumper.
Devin Booker finished with 15 points, six assists and four rebounds for Phoenix, while Nurkis and Tyus Jones had 11 apiece.
Harden led the new-look Clippers with 29 points, 12 rebounds and eight assists, but he had eight turnovers.
Zubac added 21 for Los Angeles, who played without the injured Kawhi Leonard.
Also on Thursday, other NBA games were played.
Others: The Intuit Dome in California hosted the game.
The Phoenix Suns began their NBA season on a positive note.
